block.p: Lindsey Clark Heard, a daughter of Perrin B. Heard and Charles Stephen Heard Jr., both of New York, was married yesterday to Robert Stewart Maloney, the son of Mary Oliver Maloney and Robert Price Maloney of Moreland Hills, Ohio. The Rev. Dr. Michael Stevens, a Congregational minister, officiated at the summer house of the bride's family in Christmas Cove, Me.

Mrs. Maloney, 29, was until November a research associate at Hornby Zeller Associates, a management consulting firm specializing in education and child welfare in Portland, Me. She graduated summa cum laude from Kenyon College and received a master's degree in education from Harvard University. Her father, a founding partner in the law firm of Sullivan & Heard, was until earlier this month a partner in the law firm of Whitman, Breed, Abbot & Morgan, both in New York. He is president of the board of the Fresh Air Fund, the nonprofit organization that provides summer vacations for New York City children. Mrs. Maloney's mother is a watercolor artist.

Mr. Maloney, 35, is known as Stew. He is a co-president and co-founder of Planet Dog, which sells dog accessories on the Internet, and a co-owner of the Casco Bay Brewing Company, both in Portland. He graduated from the University of Vermont. His father retired as a regional sales director for the former Sharon Steel Corporation in Sharon, Pa.
